metadata.title: Inference of transmission network structure from HIV phylogenetic trees Supplementary information Approximate Bayesian Computation for model choice

abstract.original_text: Within the ABC-SMC approach [1], particles are first generated from the prior distribution. Particles are then resampled from the obtained sample, and slightly perturbed. From these resampled particles, a new sample is formed, from which again particles are resampled, etc.

sentences.segment_text: Within the ABC-SMC approach ( 1 ) ,
particles are first generated from the prior distribution .
Particles are then resampled from the obtained sample , and slightly perturbed .
From these resampled particles , a new sample is formed ,
from which again particles are resampled , etc. .

abstract.original_text: The threshold value for the summary statistic -below which new particles are accepted -is lowered with every newly obtained sample. As a result, the acceptance rate decreases and the acceptance threshold approaches zero with an increase in the number of iterations (resamplings).
